sub_topic: Finding the volume of a sphere inscribed in a cube.
message_1: What is the volume of a sphere that is inscribed in a cube with an edge length of 8 cm?
message_2:
A sphere inscribed in a cube touches the cube at the center of each face. The diameter of the sphere is equal to the edge length of the cube. In this case, the diameter of the sphere is 8 cm.

The radius of the sphere is half of the diameter, so the radius is 8/2 = 4 cm.

The formula for the volume of a sphere is given by:

V = (4/3)πr^3

where V is the volume and r is the radius.

Substitute the radius into the formula:

V = (4/3)π(4^3)

V = (4/3)π(64)

V = (256/3)π

The volume of the sphere is approximately (256/3)π cubic centimeters.
